CODIF_DATA.RP_REGULATION: European Economic Area (EEA), with participation by GPA countries

ML_TI_DOC.TI_TEXT: Инженерни услуги по проектиране и конструиране

SHORT_CONTRACT_DESCRIPTION.P: This assignment is for engineering design services in a group contract including engineering design management and shall include the professions PGL, ARK, RIAKU, RIB, RIBR, RIV, RIE and LARK. Analysis, not necessarily TEK applies for RIBR engineering design services.
The PGL function shall not be carried out by one of the companies carrying out the engineering design services.
Note: to register your interest in this notice and obtain any additional information please visit the Doffin web site at http://www.doffin.no/Search/Search_Switch.aspx?ID=220701.

ECONOMIC_OPERATORS_PERSONAL_SITUATION.P: Company registration certificate.
Evidence of enrolment on the professional or trade register, as required by national law, in the country where the company is established.
Value added tax certificate (national requirement).
Company tax certificate (national requirement).
Self-declaration in compliance with appendix 2 (HSE) of the Norwegian procurement regulations (national requirement).
2.5 Requirements regarding the tenderer’s qualifications.

The qualification requirements are minimum requirements regarding the tenderer’s suitability to provide the actual service. The aim of the qualification requirements is to ensure that the tenderers have the necessary basis for fulfilling the contract. All the requirements must be fulfilled in order for a tenderer to be qualified. The tenderer must document fulfilment of the requirements by enclosing the documentation listed under each requirement. The documentation shall be enclosed with the tender.
— Tax certificate.
The tenderer is required to fulfil his obligations as regards tax payments.
Documentation:
— Tax certificate, issued by the chief municipal treasurer.

Norwegian tenderers shall enclose a tax certificate, issued by the chief municipal treasurer where the tenderer has his main office. Other tenderers shall enclose equivalent certificates or a statement from a competent authority in their home country. The tax certificate shall not be older than 6 months calculated from the deadline for receipt of tenders.
— VAT certificate.
The tenderer is required to fulfil his obligations as regards VAT payments.
Documentation:
— VAT certificate, issued by the tax collector.

Norwegian tenderers shall enclose a VAT certificate, issued by the tax collector where the tenderer has his main office. Other tenderers shall enclose equivalent certificates or a statement from a competent authority in their home country. The tax certificate shall not be older than 6 months calculated from the deadline for receipt of tenders.
— Fulfilment of SHA (HES).
Tenderers who shall carry out work in Norway must fulfil the current health, safety and working environment requirements set by Norwegian authorities.
Documentation:
— SHA (HES) self-declaration,
— The tenderer’s company.
The tenderer is required to have a legally established company.
Documentation:
— Registration certificate in the relevant trade or company register in the company’s home country (company registration certificate for Norwegian suppliers),
— Competence.

This procurement will include measures which require applications in accordance with the national building codes §20-1. The measures requiring applications come under the right to be responsible and the technical manager is therefore required to have the competence (education and experience) which is necessary for achieving local certification for the right to be responsible for development class 3 in responsible applicant/engineering designer and independent inspection of engineering design services functions, and the company is required to fulfil the other requirements for such certification. Equivalent documentation shall be provided for any contract helpers.

The new national building codes state that from 1.7.2011 central certification is required for companies which shall have inspection functions in measures which require applications If the tenderer does not have this certification by the time the tender is given, an application is to be sent in good time before the rules comes into force. Tenderers which currently have central certification for the inspection of engineering design services are obliged to renew this in good time before the old certification becomes invalid 30.6.2011.
Documentation:
— Valid proof of central certification for the right to be responsible within the relevant profession and function,

— Documentation that the company fulfils the requirements for local right to be responsible for the measure within the relevant development class and function. See the regulations for construction (case 10) third part – certification and responsibility for further information on the requirements for achieving such certification,
— Confirmation that the company obliges to apply for central certification for inspection of engineering design services by the time the new requirement comes into force.
